ygData.subject: RE: Pottery
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes and it is a total failure and waste of time.  Look at smithing at one time yes you could make money now you can get a full suit at cost. Almost the same
ygData.messageBody:
Yes and it is a total failure and waste of time. Look at smithing at one
time yes you could make money now you can get a full suit at cost. Almost
the same with fletching, Brewing and baking are almost a total waste since
you can buy cheaper from vendors, Tinkering doesn't even really work most of
its items are not cost effective or just don't work. Jeweler making is the
ONLY skill so far that might work and that is only from the high end items
which take so much money to make only high level people can afford. This
IMHO is a big strike against EQ and have been saying it since the early
beta.


Xakthan
Lord of Shadows
Follower of the Crimson Knights

<--- Enigma --->
http://members.door.net/enigma

-----Original Message-----
From: Aaron Braunstein [mailto:aaron_spam@...]
Sent: Monday, July 26, 1999 9:17 AM
To: EQCheats@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQCheats] Pottery

From: Aaron Braunstein <aaron_spam@...>

>I have read NO other true statements from them about profit or not
>profit. But then again, I guess
>their actions with these patches speak louder than words.

I have read at least two interviews with Brad McQuaid
describing how they view trade skills, and he has explicitly stated
in no uncertain terms that they do not want any of the player trade
skills to be implemented in such a way so as to allow for a player to
purchase items from vendors, execute their skill, and sell the
results of their efforts back to vendors at a profit. The way they
want it to work is to offer players a 'sweet spot' between what they
paid for materials and what NPC vendors charge for an equivilant item
to what a player can make themselves through their tradecraft. This
way, a player is encouraged to sell their wares at a profit to other
players and not at a loss to vendors.
In this way, they want to stimulate the "player run economy"
and not a "kick back and make a bunch of plat just interacting with
vendors"-type approach. I'm not saying I agree with it, I'm just
passing on what I know to be true... not player speculation or rumor,
but actual statements from The Man. :)

--
Aaron Braunstein
Pacific Data Management, Inc.

<aaron_braunstein@...>
